title: AI Training Performance Degradation
description: Troubleshoot high CPU/Memory usage and system unresponsiveness during AI model training.

steps.title: Monitor Resource Usage
steps.instruction: Open Task Manager (Ctrl+Shift+Esc) → Performance tab. Identify if CPU, RAM, or Disk is hitting 100%.

steps.title: Adjust Batch Size
steps.instruction: Reduce the batch size in your training script (e.g., from 32 to 16 or 8). This significantly lowers memory pressure.

steps.title: Enable Gradient Accumulation
steps.instruction: If memory is the bottleneck, use gradient accumulation to maintain a large 'effective' batch size while using less VRAM/RAM.

steps.title: Set Process Priority
steps.instruction: Task Manager → Details → Right-click python.exe → Set Priority → Below Normal. This keeps the Windows UI responsive.

steps.title: Check Thermal Throttling
steps.instruction: Use a tool like HWMonitor to check temperatures. High heat causes the system to slow down to protect hardware.
